sandy.util.NumberUtil

type
class
Utility class for useful numeric constants and number manipulation. @author Thomas Pfeiffer - kiroukou @author Niel Drummond - haXe port @version 3.1 @date 26.07.2007

Static Variables

HALF_PI : Float

Math constant pi/2

PI : Float

Math constant pi

TOL : Float

Value used to compare numbers with.

Basically used to say if a number is zero or not.
Adjust this number with regard to the precision of your application

TO_DEGREE : Float

Constant used to convert angle from radians to degrees

TO_RADIAN : Float

Constant used to convert degrees to radians.

TWO_PI : Float

Math constant 2*pi

Static Methods

areEqual(p_nN : Float, p_nM : Float) : Bool

parameters:
p_nN The first number
p_nM The second number
returns:
true if the numbers are regarded as equal, false otherwise.
Are the numbers close enough to be regarded as equal?.

Adjust the TOL property depending on the precision of your application

constrain(p_nN : Float, p_nMin : Float, p_nMax : Float) : Float

parameters:
p_nN The number to constrain
p_nMin The minimal valid value
p_nMax The maximal valid value
returns:
The constrained number
Constrains a number to a given interval

isZero(p_nN : Float) : Bool

parameters:
p_nN The number to compare to zero
returns:
true if the number is to be regarded as zero, false otherwise.
Is the number small enough to be regarded as zero?.

Adjust the TOL property depending on the precision of your application

roundTo(p_nN : Float, ?p_nRoundToInterval : Float) : Float

parameters:
p_nN The number to round off
p_nRoundToInterval The accuracy to which to round
returns:
The rounded number
Rounds a number to specified accuracy.

To round off the number to 2 decimals, set the the accuracy to 0.01

toDegree(p_nRad : Float) : Float

parameters:
p_nRad A number representing the angle in radians
returns:
The angle in degrees
Converts an angle from radians to degrees

toRadian(p_nDeg : Float) : Float

parameters:
p_nDeg A number representing the angle in dregrees
returns:
The angle in radians
Converts an angle from degrees to radians.
